name: Ian Lim
short_description: Ian Lim is currently working at a stealth startup and has connections to Stanford University. He co-founded Stanford BCI and was an organizer for TreeHacks. Ian was recognized on MinneInno's 25 Under 25 List of rising entrepreneurs and technologists in Minnesota.
long_description:
Ian Lim is a professional currently working at a stealth startup while maintaining ties to Stanford University. His entrepreneurial spirit is evident through his co-founding of Stanford BCI (Brain-Computer Interface) and his role as an organizer for TreeHacks, Stanford's hackathon. 

In September 2018, Ian was recognized on MinneInno's 25 Under 25 List, which highlights Minnesota's most promising young entrepreneurs and technologists under the age of 25. This recognition underscores his early achievements in the technology and entrepreneurship space.

Ian maintains an active presence on LinkedIn with 3,000+ followers and over 500 connections, suggesting he has built a substantial professional network. He appears to have interests in artificial intelligence, education technology, and talent development based on his LinkedIn activity. Ian also maintains a personal website at ianlim.com and can be found on Twitter under the handle @ianclim.

While his LinkedIn profile doesn't detail his specific educational background or full work history, his association with Stanford University and his involvement in technical projects like Stanford BCI indicate a background in technology, possibly with a focus on neurotechnology or human-computer interaction.
